body_html:
The easiest way I've found is to save the <svg> element to a .svg file, and then in-line all the CSS. There's a handy bookmarklet that does it for you, found here: http://nytimes.github.io/svg-crowbar/

Either use the SVG file as-is, or convert it to PNG with a drawing program of your choice, or an online converter.
body_text:
The easiest way I've found is to save the <svg> element to a .svg file, and then in-line all the CSS. There's a handy bookmarklet that does it for you, found here: http://nytimes.github.io/svg-crowbar/
Either use the SVG file as-is, or convert it to PNG with a drawing program of your choice, or an online converter.
body:
The easiest way I've found is to save the `<svg>` element to a .svg file, and then in-line all the CSS. There's a handy bookmarklet that does it for you, found here: http://nytimes.github.io/svg-crowbar/

Either use the SVG file as-is, or convert it to PNG with a drawing program of your choice, or an online converter.
